name: Obviously the time continuum has been disrupted...again and again and again!
description: Eadweard Muybridge was able to capture time and play it back again creating endless time paradoxes where subjects are destined to repeat their previous actions. Filmmakers have since explored such notions via time travel narratives questioning destiny, fate and choice.

key_work.title: Edweard Muybridge Horse in Motion
key_work.brief_description: Muybridge was the first person to render time visible by breaking movement down into increments of time – influencing artists to the present day.

constellations_primary.name: Obviously the time continuum has been disrupted...again and again and again!
constellations_primary.description: Eadweard Muybridge was able to capture time and play it back again creating endless time paradoxes where subjects are destined to repeat their previous actions. Filmmakers have since explored such notions via time travel narratives questioning destiny, fate and choice.

start.title: Repeat Performance
start.creator_credit: Aubrey Schenck, Aubrey Schenck Productions, Bryan Foy Productions, Alfred L. Werker and Walter Bullock
start.brief_description: On New Year’s Eve 1946, Broadway actress Sheila Page apparently callously shoots dead her husband Barney. As she leaves the crime scene, she wishes she could play the year over with a different script. - Wikipedia

constellations_other.name: Obviously the time continuum has been disrupted...again and again and again!
constellations_other.description: Eadweard Muybridge was able to capture time and play it back again creating endless time paradoxes where subjects are destined to repeat their previous actions. Filmmakers have since explored such notions via time travel narratives questioning destiny, fate and choice.

end.title: The Girl Who Leapt Through Time
end.creator_credit: Yuichiro Saito, Jungo Maruta, Takafumi Watanabe, Happinet Pictures, Kadokawa, Memory Tech, Q-Tec, Toki wo Kakeru Shôjo Seisaku Iinkai 2006, Madhouse, Sound Box, Kadokawa Shoten, Mamoru Hosoda and Satoko Okudera
end.brief_description: When 17-year-old Makoto Konno gains the ability to, quite literally, “leap” backwards through time, she immediately sets about improving her grades and preventing personal mishaps. However, she soon realises that changing the past isn’t as simple as it seems, and eventually, will have to rely on her new powers to shape the future of herself and her friends.

constellations_other.name: Obviously the time continuum has been disrupted...again and again and again!
constellations_other.description: Eadweard Muybridge was able to capture time and play it back again creating endless time paradoxes where subjects are destined to repeat their previous actions. Filmmakers have since explored such notions via time travel narratives questioning destiny, fate and choice.

links.description: High schooler Makoto Konno is similarly given the power to time travel and uses it to fix past mistakes, but soon discovers her actions can adversely affect others leaving Makoto to choose how to use her final time leaps wisely.

start.title: Edweard Muybridge Horse in Motion
start.brief_description: Muybridge was the first person to render time visible by breaking movement down into increments of time – influencing artists to the present day.

end.title: Repeat Performance
end.creator_credit: Aubrey Schenck, Aubrey Schenck Productions, Bryan Foy Productions, Alfred L. Werker and Walter Bullock
end.brief_description: On New Year’s Eve 1946, Broadway actress Sheila Page apparently callously shoots dead her husband Barney. As she leaves the crime scene, she wishes she could play the year over with a different script. - Wikipedia

constellations_other.name: Obviously the time continuum has been disrupted...again and again and again!
constellations_other.description: Eadweard Muybridge was able to capture time and play it back again creating endless time paradoxes where subjects are destined to repeat their previous actions. Filmmakers have since explored such notions via time travel narratives questioning destiny, fate and choice.

links.description: Film-noir crime drama Repeat Performance gives lead character Sheila the ability to relive a year in her life in the hopes that she will not repeat her past mistakes which saw her kill her husband. Yet in this world fate finds its own way of repeating itself.

start.title: The Girl Who Leapt Through Time
start.creator_credit: Yuichiro Saito, Jungo Maruta, Takafumi Watanabe, Happinet Pictures, Kadokawa, Memory Tech, Q-Tec, Toki wo Kakeru Shôjo Seisaku Iinkai 2006, Madhouse, Sound Box, Kadokawa Shoten, Mamoru Hosoda and Satoko Okudera
start.brief_description: When 17-year-old Makoto Konno gains the ability to, quite literally, “leap” backwards through time, she immediately sets about improving her grades and preventing personal mishaps. However, she soon realises that changing the past isn’t as simple as it seems, and eventually, will have to rely on her new powers to shape the future of herself and her friends.

constellations_other.description: Eadweard Muybridge was able to capture time and play it back again creating endless time paradoxes where subjects are destined to repeat their previous actions. Filmmakers have since explored such notions via time travel narratives questioning destiny, fate and choice.

end.title: Dark
end.brief_description: A missing child causes four families to help each other for answers. What they could not imagine is that this mystery would be connected to innumerable other secrets of the small town.

constellations_other.name: There's always a lighthouse
constellations_other.description: The thaumatrope was an early optical illusion device popular in the Victorian era and was important to the development of the moving image.

constellations_other.name: Obviously the time continuum has been disrupted...again and again and again!
constellations_other.description: Eadweard Muybridge was able to capture time and play it back again creating endless time paradoxes where subjects are destined to repeat their previous actions. Filmmakers have since explored such notions via time travel narratives questioning destiny, fate and choice.

links.description: The lopping multi-generational timelines in Dark also interrogate the implications of trying to fix the past mistakes of time. Existentially questioning fate and choice, the first-ever German-language Netflix original focuses on how the past affects the future, and importantly, how the future affects the past.

start.title: Looper
start.creator_credit: Ram Bergman, James D. Stern, Ram Bergman Productions, Endgame Entertainment, DMG Entertainment, FilmDistrict, Ed Verreaux, Sharen Davis, Rian Johnson and TriStar Pictures
start.headline_credit: China and United States of America, 2012
start.brief_description: In the futuristic action thriller Looper, time travel will be invented but it will be illegal and only available on the black market, where the mob uses it to send hitmen into the past to assassinate targets.

constellations_other.name: Obviously the time continuum has been disrupted...again and again and again!
constellations_other.description: Eadweard Muybridge was able to capture time and play it back again creating endless time paradoxes where subjects are destined to repeat their previous actions. Filmmakers have since explored such notions via time travel narratives questioning destiny, fate and choice.

end.title: Je T'Aime, Je T'Aime
end.creator_credit: Mag Bodard, Parc Film, Les Productions Fox Europa, Alain Resnais and Jacques Sternberg
end.brief_description: Recovering from an attempted suicide, a man is selected to participate in a time travel experiment that has only been tested on mice. A malfunction in the experiment causes the man to experience moments from his past in a random order.

constellations_other.name: Obviously the time continuum has been disrupted...again and again and again!
constellations_other.description: Eadweard Muybridge was able to capture time and play it back again creating endless time paradoxes where subjects are destined to repeat their previous actions. Filmmakers have since explored such notions via time travel narratives questioning destiny, fate and choice.

links.description: Claude is also caught in his own loop in French sci-fi Je T’Aime, Je T’Amie. After agreeing to an experimental time travel study he’s supposed to be sent back one year for a minute, but gets stuck in an endless loop with death his only escape.

start.title: Dark
start.brief_description: A missing child causes four families to help each other for answers. What they could not imagine is that this mystery would be connected to innumerable other secrets of the small town.

Filmmakers have since explored such notions via time travel narratives questioning destiny, fate and choice.

end.title: Back to the future
end.creator_credit: Robert Zemeckis, Neil Canton, Bob Gale and Amblin Entertainment
end.brief_description: Marty McFly (Michael J Fox) and Doc (Christopher Lloyd) have to save the present by going back to the future in this classic from the 1980s.

constellations_other.name: Obviously the time continuum has been disrupted...again and again and again!
constellations_other.description: Eadweard Muybridge was able to capture time and play it back again creating endless time paradoxes where subjects are destined to repeat their previous actions. Filmmakers have since explored such notions via time travel narratives questioning destiny, fate and choice.

links.description: Wait a minute, Doc, are you trying to tell me that my mother has got the hots for me? 1980s classic Back to the Future also explores the implications of time travel with drastic multi-generational ramifications!

start.title: Back to the future
start.creator_credit: Robert Zemeckis, Neil Canton, Bob Gale and Amblin Entertainment
start.brief_description: Marty McFly (Michael J Fox) and Doc (Christopher Lloyd) have to save the present by going back to the future in this classic from the 1980s.

constellations_other.description: Eadweard Muybridge was able to capture time and play it back again creating endless time paradoxes where subjects are destined to repeat their previous actions. Filmmakers have since explored such notions via time travel narratives questioning destiny, fate and choice.

end.title: Looper
end.creator_credit: Ram Bergman, James D. Stern, Ram Bergman Productions, Endgame Entertainment, DMG Entertainment, FilmDistrict, Ed Verreaux, Sharen Davis, Rian Johnson and TriStar Pictures
end.headline_credit: China and United States of America, 2012
end.brief_description: In the futuristic action thriller Looper, time travel will be invented but it will be illegal and only available on the black market, where the mob uses it to send hitmen into the past to assassinate targets.

constellations_other.name: Obviously the time continuum has been disrupted...again and again and again!
constellations_other.description: Eadweard Muybridge was able to capture time and play it back again creating endless time paradoxes where subjects are destined to repeat their previous actions. Filmmakers have since explored such notions via time travel narratives questioning destiny, fate and choice.

links.description: Rian Johnson’s Looper also has a time loop and sees “present-day” contract killers assassinating targets who have been sent back from the future. Known as ‘loopers’, the main character Joe must one day close the loop, liquidating his older self who appears as his next target.
